metadata.Title: CVE-2020-19188 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer Overflow vulnerability in fmt_entry function in progs/dump_entry.c:1116 in ncurses 6.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via crafted command.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-19188` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lib32ncurses6 - 6.3-2ubuntu0.1
lib32ncursesw6 - 6.3-2ubuntu0.1
lib32tinfo6 - 6.3-2ubuntu0.1
lib64ncurses6 - 6.3-2ubuntu0.1
lib64ncursesw6 - 6.3-2ubuntu0.1
lib64tinfo6 - 6.3-2ubuntu0.1
libncurses5 - 6.3-2ubuntu0.1
libncurses6 - 6.3-2ubuntu0.1
libncursesw5 - 6.3-2ubuntu0.1
libncursesw6 - 6.3-2ubuntu0.1
libtinfo5 - 6.3-2ubuntu0.1
libtinfo6 - 6.3-2ubuntu0.1
ncurses-base - 6.3-2ubuntu0.1
ncurses-bin - 6.3-2ubuntu0.1
ncurses-examples - 6.3-2ubuntu0.1
ncurses-term - 6.3-2ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ncurses package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.3-2ubuntu0.1').
